Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for sleeping one night in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: iosebah
Reviews.Content: If you have to sleep in Madrid and continue your trip to another place, this can be a good place. From airport, you can get near with the metro and after walking a short time, get there. The same for the next day. The room was huge, with tv, sofa and living room, private bathroom and great bedroom. I think that's for bussines people, but if you get a good price, it's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base”
Reviews.Author: Emma M
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed this hotel. It is far from the city, but this is not always a bad thing, the metro stop is across the road and the area is very nice. If you enjoy eating in non tourist places and hence saving a few euros and eating with the locals then it is perfect. The room was surprisingly big, very clean and modern. I didn't get breakfast as there are some nice local cafes in the area. All in all I would stay again if you want a quiet break, the view from the window isn't great but your in Madrid, get out and walk about!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: The NH Prisma is located in Chamberi, this is 4 metro stops north of the old town centre (Plaza Mayor / Sol station). The distance is walkable if you feel like wandering around with no predetermined destination. It would take about 45 minutes to an hour. The good thing is that the route is downhill. Nevertheless as I mentioned before the metro is quick and efficient and the metro entrance is located in front of the hotel entrance. The hotel occupies a compound of buildings. The reception and some rooms are in one block, the bigger rooms / suites (where I stayed) are in a different building and the restaurant is located on a third building. It is quite nice having to walk out into the fresh air to move between buildings. The exterior of the buildings themselves need some cleaning and paint. It actually gave me a bad first impression when I arrived, but on the next few days I didn't care for this so much, perhaps it reflects the general condition of the city and rather than run-down it looks normal after a while. The interior on the contrary is impeccable, furniture and spaces in good condition, good air quality and cleanliness. Our room was a superior room. A small suite with entrance hall, reception room, bedroom, bathroom and two closets. TVs in both rooms, minibar (expensive), stereo, safe and bathroom with full set of toiletries. The bed was very comfortable, not soft but firm. The window view, facing to the south was questionable. On the mid distance there was an amazing old brick tower of great architectural interest, but right under our window there was a parking lot/distribution centre for the street cleaning rubbish collection service of the city. To be fair, we never opened the window and didn't get any smells and during the daytime the shutters had to be down to stop the summer heat so there was nothing to see anyways. I would say that the best aspect of this hotel was the personal service and the breakfast buffet. The restaurant space is beautiful and comfortable. The food was plenty. Eggs, breads, pastries, cereals, local cheeses and hams. Fresh fruits, cakes, churros con chocolate, several types of fresh juices. The attention of the ladies in the restaurant was excellent, always smiling and helpful. There is free wi-fi but only in the lobby space. I would also like to add that I appreciated the fact that the hotel uses energy from renewable resources and seems to have a number of initiatives that reflect its care for the environment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with home as room & full range of breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: IngLele
Reviews.Content: 3 building form NH Hotel Prisma which are standard flats as hotel's rooms. It's fantastic to have 3 rooms: 1 big bedroom, 1 great bathroom and 1 living room with sofa. Breakfast has full wide of different food and 4 types of milks! Bed is really comfortable and rooms are clean. Rios Rosas metro station is just in front of the street. It's easy to arrive from airport in 30 minutes and to city center in 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “very good, I will come back as soon as I can”
Reviews.Author: Elisa p
Reviews.Content: We had two double rooms for a weekend and we really liked it. The rooms were all suites with hall, livingroom, bedroom and bath; very nice and spacious. Breakfast was a blessing with juices and homemade bakery, hot dishes, fruits... !!! The service was also great! they were very polite and helpfull all the time. The hotel was well situated having a metro station just in front of it (20 meters). Taxis are also running all the time so it`s well connected.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value though not necessarily cheap.”
Reviews.Author: PdhGB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a rather grand suite, with twin beds and a large lounge, in late November 2011. The hotel consisted of 2 (or maybe 3) buildings next door to each other in a small plaza off the main road. Too far to walk to most attractions for most people, I would think, but it is easily accessed by metro if you use the southern most exit from the Rios Rosas line (I think it's line 1 but check). The exit is for "Plaza del Descubidor Diego de Ordas" and is right opposite the plaza and the hotel reception is in the second building on the left, about 100 meteres from the metro exit. The continental style breakfast was in probably the best of that type we have had anywhere though we had to go to the building next door for it. We had a discount price of around £65 inc breakfast and for this it was excellent value but even at the full rate, which I think would be around two and a half times as much, it would be acceptable value (though we couldn't afford it!)

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mothersap
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Have mixed reactions that results in an overall average rating. On the plus side: the suites provide an unusually large amount of room for a European hotel, the metro is steps away, the breakfast is top-notch with very friendly assistants constantly re-stocking and cleaning. On the downside: the location is in a not so interesting part of Madrid (but easily reached via the metro), friendly enough day front desk staff but rather rude individuals in the evening, noise - all kinds of noise - the noise came from everywhere, including the footsteps of what seemed like a 300 pound gorilla in heels in the room above me, fire trucks, shaking walls, etc, expensive in-room internet service that consistently dropped out.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Vesna M
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days in NH prisma in October and would come back again. Suites are very well fitted and comfortable. Staff was friendly and discreet. Hotel is next to metro station and it takes only 5 station (10 mins) to reach city center. Although there is free wifi at the reception area, there is no free internet in the suites and the cost of having one is rather expensive @ 10 eur/ day. Also, you can't get dinner at the hotel, however hotel offers good deal for in room deliveries of pizza's and burgers.

Reviews.Title: “Would be perfect if there was a pool”
Reviews.Author: JessicaVMPatrick
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room with 2 bedrooms. It was all very nicely decorated. The bathroon was huge and very nice. Shower was excellent. It is a very short walk to the metro, only 30 seconds or so. Check out was not so good. There is a public parking underneath the hotel which is very convenient. Only minus is that the garage does not accept creditcards. Bring your paper money or coins if you want to pay...This should have been said by reception at check out but was not. So we spend 20 minutes on finding an ATM, walking back and finding it did not accept 50 euro bills, get back again etc.... They forgot to ask about our stay so it was just pay and goodbye. No personal service here...too bad cause it could have made a difference... Breakfast was one of the best we had. Good variety of food, very good service and nice and quiet. Good quality food. We had no real problems with the fire station noise. One night it woke me up but my bed was so good that I got back to sleep again in a minute. All in all for the low price it was really good value!

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled room not ready for occupancy!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly55229
Reviews.Content: Got a great price because the hotel is under renovation but it was the worst night of our 16 day trip. Air conditioning did not work in either of our two suites. Water was yellow! The poor girl on duty by herself could not help us! I am sure the updates will be awesome when tested and complete but we barely survived the night! They could have offered a fan or something! On the positive side, it was very convenient to the Metro and our daughter's apartment.

Reviews.Title: “FIRE SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: Sarajon1985
Reviews.Content: Refurbished hotel, ok but the painters masking tape over the smoke alarms is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did the job”
Reviews.Author: C Saloux
Reviews.Content: Had annual lads (we are all over 50) tour and chose Madrid this time. Booked into NH Prisma - just used it as some place to sleep - and have some breakfast - nothing else. It is a businessman's hotel - I had a bedroom, large separate lounge, bathroom - all fine - no frills but no complaints. About 15 mins into the centre of Madrid via the excellent and cheap underground system - however if I go to Madrid again I will staying at a hotel in the centre. NHS Prisma is not suitable or designed for kids. Flew in from Edinburgh with Easyjet - excellent flight - no delays, arrived early. I have had several flights with Easyjet now and was apprehensive about using them at first. I have never had a problem with them. Landed at Madrid later than the other blokes I was with who were flying from London - got my way from the airport to the hotel by Tube - pretty easy. I think it only cost E2 which is amazing value. The weather was a bit cold and wet but we found plenty to do - walking round the town, having a look at an art gallery, watching sport in the various and numerous pubs we visited. Ate the lovely ham till it was coming out of my ears - lots of restaurants to choose from. Had an interesting "lunch" on the Saturday when we wandered into the old town and found an old sherry bar. It was a beautifully run down place - decor about 40 years out of date - bar tab written in chalk on the counter - bottles of sherry filled directly from barrels. Wonderfully surly barman - wouldn't let us take pictures of his bar. A peculiar lunch but a great experience. As seems to be the norm, one of our party was pick-pocketed on a late night wander round town. No violence just 3 guys "offering advice" on which club to go to - a pat on the back here, a tap on the shoulder there. In an instant he lost a phone, money and a credit card and didn't sense a thing - just be aware that there are opportunists out there just like any other big city. I liked Madrid and will go again but I will stay somewhere closer to the centre next time.

Reviews.Title: “clean & spacious, but not very charming”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Sept 2010. This hotel was part of our guided tour. The rooms in this hotel are suites - separate living room with sleeper sofa/upholstered chair & desk. There's 2 small hallways that connect the 3 rooms (livingroom, bedroom, bathroom)- wasted space in my opinion. The furniture is Ikea level stuff . Blond wood paneling & furniture makes it seem like a dorm room. There are 2 small flat-screen TVs - one in living room & 1 in bedroom. Small stereo system in living room as well. The bathroom is done in white carrera marble - a little stark & old-fashioned looking. There's a safe in the bedroom but the closet is pretty small with few hangers. The beds are OK - just blankets no comforters. There is a hair dryer in the bathroom but we asked multiple times for an iron and never got one - booh! I read some other reviews of this hotel complaining its a long walk to the Metro. They must have gotten lost as the Metro station is 4 minutes away at the corner of Santa Engracia and Rios Rosas. It's a quick 7 minute subway ride to Puerta del Sol. Only costs 1 Euro!! Clean and efficient, not charming unless you think a dorm room is charming. It's inexpensive though - on the hotel's website, a room is only 85 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, Good services and good location”
Reviews.Author: Cirkel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the NH Prisma for 4 nights in August and must say we thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms were very large consisting of a separate living room and bedroom which were very clean. Only a couple minor complaint was that one for some part of the stay we think they turned off the hot water however when we complained it mysteriously came back on! and two Could have done with an extra pillow on the bed! The Hotel itself was very Conveniently located, right across from the Rios Rosas metro station which is only a few stops from central Madrid. We used it everyday to get everywhere. The outside of the hotel made a nice presentation, with the beautiful flowers and a fountain which was all very clean. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance if you don't fancy eating in the Hotel or you can get the metro in central Madrid which is what we did a couple of times. The breakfast buffet offered a wide choice of breads, juices, meats, cheeses, fruit and even chocolate doughnuts! There was plenty of choice and the stock levels were always kept up so no problems there. The breakfast staff were friendly and didn't seem to rush you. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is staying in Madrid and if we ever to came back to Madrid, would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: svelo
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with professional and friendly staff. Right next to the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisagalnj
Reviews.Content: Although this was not smack in the middle of downtown Madrid, it was right across from the Rios Rosas metro stop, and just a few stops from downtown. The metro system is extremely easy and safe, so no issue at all to hop on and go anywhere. We booked this for 61 Euros a night, and got quite a nice suite. Per the other reviews, we asked for a room "away from the fire station", and I think we insulted them, so they put us right next to the fire station. Sigh. Our air conditioner wheezed out a few gasps of coolish air, and after a fitful nap (post flight), we went to the front desk and asked to be moved. The a/c in the second room was perfect, and the second room was now on the side AWAY from the fire station, so we were very relieved. We stayed for 4 nights. A comment on the restaurant: we ordered two bowls of gazpacho, and the price was 27 Euros. Say what? I'm still mad at myself for falling for that. The next day, out for a stroll to explore the area, I took a right out of the hotel and walked for a couple of blocks, and stumbled on this cool little juice bar, where you can get gazpacho, fresh juice, and mineral water for 9 Euros. MUCH better. And they have beer. In the morning, we'd take a left out of the hotel, walk by the fire station (make sure to take a peek at the fire trucks...hysterical! Covered with pretty cool graffiti), and a block down there's a little bar on the corner where you can have the world's best cafe con leche and pastries. if you so much as use just a couple of Spanish words, you'll be rewarded with a big grin. All you have to do is repeat after them...Buenos Dias! The outside of the hotel made a nice presentation, with the beautiful flowers and fountain. Aside from the nerdy redhead who assigned us to the first fire station room, the rest were friendly enough. Overall, I found this to be an excellent choice in hotel, and have already recommended this to anyone who will listen.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious but not central, not convenient, and certainly, not charming.”
Reviews.Author: sallyforth60
Reviews.Content: NH Prisma hotel was the choice of the tour company I traveled with... not mine. It was not "five minutes" from the city center as indicated-- more like 25 if you count the walk to the metro and the travel time. It is located in the Santa Engracia area which is not on the typical tourist map-- too far out. The neighborhood was not unpleasant, but it lacked any distinct character and was not close to any of the major sights. I discovered a nice bar around the corner and a small, friendly grocery a few blocks away, but in general the area was uninteresting. The hotel consists of three huge cement blocks, and apparently, a restaurant, but I never did find it. The buffet style breakfast was varied and plentiful . My room consisted of a good-sized "salon" with massive TV and sound system which I did not know how to operate. A separate bedroom and bath were spacious and clean. The bathroom window, unfortunately, looked into some sort of office suite located inside the hotel... odd. Internet (expensive and not private) was availble in the small, cramped lobby space. The staff was rather cool and distant; the elevator was tiny, and the view from any of the rooms was onto a congested boulevard or a cement courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, delicious breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: voljo
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the beautiful entrance to the hotel with lovely fountains. The hotel is part of a complex that also includes apartment residences. Rooms in the hotel resemble suites in that they include a living room area and a separate bedroom. The space, however, is rather chopped up with doors sometimes opening in the wrong direction so you have to be careful not to bump into one. Two roomy closets! We had problems getting the shower to work, but housekeeping quickly sent someone up to make adjustments. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of fresh choices. We took advantage of the hotel's proximity to a Metro stop and rode the subway to the downtown area several times without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location in citycenter. nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pradomalo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there with some colleagues on the end of january for business. The rooms are nice, not incredible, but comfortable. All of them are suites with living room. The location is good too, is 5 min taxi from oldtown and there are 3 different tube stations close by. Negative point: the amenities! usually nh hotels offer many amenities, I just got the shampoo and shower gel, very poor, maybe due to the crisis? Anyway the breakfast is really good, there's many choice and good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but avoid rooms near Fire Station”
Reviews.Author: ABRH
Reviews.Content: I would agree with previous comments, that this is a very good hotel. Rooms (genuine sized suites) are a good size, clean, and with excellent amenities (the 'goodies provided in the bathroom are great). Staff on the front desk are helpful e.g. being willing to call taxi's etc. The breakfast room offers a wide choice of breads, juices, meats, cheeses, fruit etc. Customer facing staff speak either good or a least passable english. Everywhere in the hotel seems clean and well organised. The only downsides that I have identified in 3 stays are: If you are there on business and want something to eat or drink in the evening, you are a bit stuck - there's no bar or restaurant, and there's a limited choice in walking distance outside. Secondly, there is a fire station adjacent to the hotel. Get the wrong room (as I did once) and you will be woken every time they get called out on an emergency, or by their very loud PA system calling them for coffee! Overall a good choice just ask to be away from that fire station!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suite hotel in a quiet, but central neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: 2ausBerlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in June at the NH-Prisma Suites in Madrid. Price: 65 Euro/night. The hotel is right across one entrance of Rio Rosas-metro station, so very accessible. Within minutes by metro you are in the very centre of Madrid. The suites are spacious, well maintained. Bed and bathroom are ok, no complaints at all. As the hotel is a bit away from the street traffic, the rooms are quiet and you could get a good nights sleep. Overall we can recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: NPombo
Reviews.Content: I had a very good Madrid weekend there. Nice staff, very clean and children feel quite welcome. I would recomend this hotel for families.
